ad_copy_guide.title: Comprehensive Guide on Writing Ad Copy for Plumbing Google Ads
ad_copy_guide.introduction: Creating effective Google Ads for plumbing services involves crafting compelling headlines, descriptions, and callouts that attract clicks and convert visitors into customers. Below is a comprehensive guide with universal rules, copy-specific rules, technical details, styles, and examples based on best practices.

universal_rules.title: Clarity and Conciseness
universal_rules.details: Always be clear and concise in your ad copy. Avoid jargon and complicated language.

universal_rules.title: Consistency
universal_rules.details: Ensure consistency between the ad copy and the landing page. The promises made in the ad should be fulfilled on the landing page.

universal_rules.title: Professional Tone
universal_rules.details: Maintain a professional and dependable tone throughout the ad copy. Avoid overly casual or promotional language.

universal_rules.title: Avoid Superlatives and Vague Claims
universal_rules.details: Do not use terms like 'best,' 'top-rated,' or 'quality service.' Instead, use verifiable facts.

universal_rules.title: Regular Testing and Optimization
universal_rules.details: Regularly A/B test different ad copy variations to see what performs best and optimize accordingly.

universal_rules.title: Avoid Exclamation Points and Excessive Punctuation
universal_rules.details: Do not use exclamation points or excessive punctuation. Keep punctuation simple and professional.

technical_details.style: Title Case for major words, avoid superlatives, use specific benefits and keywords

universal_rules.details: Include the primary service or offer. Highlight unique selling points and quantifiable benefits.
Capitalize major words to make the headline stand out.
Use verifiable facts instead of vague claims.

technical_details.style: Sentence case, clear and concise language, include strong CTAs

universal_rules.rule: Highlight Key Benefits and Unique Selling Points
universal_rules.details: Focus on what sets your service apart.
Avoid jargon and keep it simple.

universal_rules.rule: Include a Strong Call to Action (CTA)
Avoid Exclamation Points and Excessive Punctuation

good.text: Get fast, reliable plumbing services. Call now for a free estimate.
good.reasoning: This description highlights key benefits (fast, reliable) and includes a strong CTA ('Call now for a free estimate'), encouraging immediate action. It adheres to the character limit.

good.text: 24/7 emergency service with no additional charges. Schedule today.
good.reasoning: This description emphasizes availability and transparency (no additional charges), with a clear CTA ('Schedule today'). It is concise and within the character limit.

good.text: Trusted by over 1000 customers. Satisfaction guaranteed.
good.reasoning: This description builds trust with social proof (trusted by over 1000 customers) and assures quality ('satisfaction guaranteed'). It is clear and concise.

good.text: No hidden fees, transparent pricing. Book your service now.
good.reasoning: This description emphasizes transparency and includes a strong CTA ('Book your service now'). It is clear and within the character limit.

bad.text: We offer comprehensive services for all your needs.
bad.reasoning: This description is vague and lacks specific benefits or a strong CTA. It does not highlight what sets the service apart.

bad.text: Reliable and efficient services for you.
bad.reasoning: This description is generic and lacks specific details or benefits. It does not include a strong CTA.
This description uses a superlative ('best in class') without specific details or verification, making it less credible.
